intro: Myosotis platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaved forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are broad and flat, which distinguishes it from other species in the genus. Myosotis platyphylla is often found in the understory of native forests, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
